text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ADEVARUL
- Government plans to cut income tax to some 30 percent, down from present 38 percent, the paper said.
- Shortage of fertilisers might reduce Romania's grain crops this year.
LIBERTATEA
- Senate to discuss draft of bill giving foreigners rights to buy land in Romania.
- Romania to settle through barter communist-era debts to Poland worth some $5.0 million.
- World Bank expected to finance social protection schemes in Romania, the paper said.
ZIUA
- Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea rejected plans by transport ministry to raise tariffs on railway transport.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Romania and Poland consider plans for joint highway project.
- Shipping in the Danube Delta hampered by ice.
- Petrolexportimport SA oil trader hopes to sign this month agreement for $200 million revolving credit with Chase Manhattan to finance crude oil imports.
CRONICA ROMANA
- Petrom RA oil company plans to invest 890 billion lei to upgrade its drilling equipment.
General:
- All papers report Romanian President Emil Constantinescu's visit to Poland.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Parliament must elect a new Superior Council of Magistrates because present members were elected for four years by former parliament and their mandate has expired.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea will announce today government's package of social protection measures.
- Romanian Foreign Minister Adrian Severin says former Romanian citizens should not pay visa fees when they enter in Romania.
ADEVARUL
- Due to child traffic in Romania, last year 934 Romanian children were taken to Italy, 778 to the United States and another 315 to Spain, newspaper quotes police report.
- Romanian negotiators say they are not running against the clock to finalise treaty with neighbouring Ukraine.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Over 37,000 schools and highschool teachers are not qualified, education ministry said.
- Lower Chamber of Deputies will hold extraordinary session from January 20 to 24.
- Bucharest will have a new mayor starting tomorow.
LIBERTATEA
- Trade unions threaten to launch protests unless the government announces urgent social protection measures.
CRONICA ROMANA
- Recent national lottery winners prefer to keep anonymous, because they are afraid to be robbed.
ZIUA

- Bilateral treaty between Romania and Ukraine must make amends for the Ribbentrop-Molotov pact, and the fate of ethnic Romanians who live in Ukraine depends on new treaty, newspaper says. ($= 4,513 lei) -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
